questions.question: The narrator places rabbits, raccoons, dogs, and deer in the setting. Why?

choices.answer: To illustrate Lennie's violence
To characterize the mood as peaceful and non-threatening
To show Lennie and George can survive in the wild by hunting
To assert this will be a happy story

questions.question: Lennie's last name is "Small." This is an example of which literary device?

choices.answer: Foreshadowing
Theme
Irony
Metaphor

questions.question: Why did George and Lennie leave Weed?

choices.answer: They were fired from their job.
George wanted to touch a girl's dress, & she misinterpreted.
Lennie wanted to touch a girl's dress, & she misinterpreted.
They lost all of their money in the Depression.

questions.question: Which line shows that George and Lennie are different from other ranch workers?

choices.answer: "An' we'll live off the fatta the lan'."
"Because I got you to look after me, and you got me..."
"An' have the rabbits."
"Hide in the brush by the river."

questions.question: Why did Aunt Clara give Lennie a rubber mouse?

choices.answer: He lost his previous one.
He was a child who needed a toy.
He was allergic to fur.
He was too rough with real ones and would kill them.

questions.question: Which BEST characterizes the relationship dynamics between Lennie and George?

choices.answer: Friends
Siblings
Parent/Child
Teacher/Student

questions.question: Which is a way that George acts like Lennie's caregiver?

choices.answer: He holds his work card for him.
He tells him not to drink the water in the stream.
He makes sure they have food for dinner.
He tells Lennie someone would mistake him for an animal.

questions.question: Which is an example of direct characterization? There may be more than 1 right answer.

choices.answer: " 'You gonna give me that mouse or do I have to sock you?' "
"small strong hands, slender arms, thin and bony nose."
"Behind him walked his opposite, a huge man..."
"Lennie looked puzzled. 'Like I done in Weed?'"

questions.question: Which is an example of indirect characterization? There may be more than 1 right answer.

choices.answer: " 'You gonna give me that mouse or do I have to sock you?' "
"small strong hands, slender arms, thin and bony nose."
"Behind him walked his opposite, a huge man..."
"Lennie looked puzzled. 'Like I done in Weed?'"
